p: Between transfused patients with and without criteria for transfusion, SD was more frequent in patients with criteria (15/25; 60%) than in those without criteria (7/27; 25.9%). Furthermore, in these groups, staying in the ICU or RW plus ICU was more frequent in transfused patients with criteria than in those transfused without criteria (p = 0.048). Additionally, transfusion side effects occurred in 4 patients (7.7%), 3 in the group without criteria and 1 in the group with criteria. These side effects included hypothermia plus urticarial rash (n = 2), urticarial rash plus chest pain (n = 1) and chest pain (n = 1). No death was reported in association with side effects ( Table 3).
